country.interesting_fact: The United States has the world's largest economy by nominal GDP.
China is home to the Great Wall, which is over 13,000 miles long.
India is the world's largest democracy and the second-most populous country.
Japan has the highest life expectancy in the world.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, which is the largest rainforest in the world.
Russia is the largest country in the world by land area, covering more than one-eighth of the Earth's inhabited land area.
Germany is known for its engineering and is home to many famous car manufacturers like BMW, Mercedes-Benz, and Volkswagen.
France is the most visited country in the world, attracting millions of tourists each year to landmarks like the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre Museum.
The United Kingdom is made up of four countries: England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland.
Australia is the only continent that is also a single country, and it is home to unique wildlife like kangaroos and koalas.
